website_summaries.verdict: Extremely sharp and powerful line cutter in these pliers works nicely on really thick fishing line.
pros: Aluminum 7.8" pliers won't rust, and they're lightweight and durable
Uses stainless steel inserts in the jaws to provide additional strength for gripping items
Spring-loaded handle, which makes it easier to use one-handed
cons: Occasional quality-control issues with pliers arriving with loose or missing parts

customer_reviews.title: Decent fishing pliers but could be better
customer_reviews.text: These do the trick, but two improvements I'd like to see are a bigger line cutter (in the dark, it's really hard to see where this tiny blade is!) and a built-in locking mechanism that will keep these closed when I'm not using them.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie R

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Pliers. Cut 65lb Braid with Ease.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used in saltwater yet, but worked great for bass fishing. I don't have high expectations of corrosion resistance for the black oxide jaws. I purchased for hook removal and cutting braid. The braid cutters worked exceptionally well for the first trip out on the 65lb braid. The hinge is smooth and tight. The jaws line up with no odd gaps or any indications of poor quality. These will be great to keep in my tackle bag, will probably buy a nicer pair of Dancos later on down the road with a more solid clip on style holder.
customer_reviews.author: DIY DadTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: rust with salt water use should wash off and lightly  oiled after use in corrosive environment
customer_reviews.text: Great value, Braided line cutters perform perfectly. Not too big not too small to retrieve hooks from deep within the mouths of fish. The case is another matter altogether, it is cumbersome and frustratingly impossible to return your pliers to without turning all of your attention and both hands to the effort. A hard plastic snap in and snap out type belt shith would be a perfect alternative to this poor design and make this the ultimate combination good quality good value your design.
customer_reviews.author: REP

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pliers and they came to me with two of the screws loose and Philips heads stripped on one of the steel inserts in the nose. Not a happy camper at all. They need to use Allen type heads instead of Philips since its impossible to get a screw driver in at a fairly straight angle. The 90 degree configuration of an Allen wrench would make it much easier. If I ever lost these pliers I would certainly not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kato

customer_reviews.title: Good for kayak fishing!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these pliers to bring along for kayak fishing. They look and work great. They come with a carrying sheath that keeps the pliers in a closed position. Outside of the sheath, they will remain in an open position, which is fine with me. I’ve used these to remove hooks from all types and sizes of fish. They provide a good grip and don’t let go. The line cutter easily slices through braid, mono, or flouro line. The clip and wound line are convenient to attach to a bungee on my kayak to remain within reach, and the cord has enough length to work with fish. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: runnin in mpls

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing 3 Years after owning
customer_reviews.text: My husband keeps borrowing my favorite pliers while offshore fishing, and I decided I was just going to buy another pair for myself and give him that pair, and when I went to find the purchase in my history to order another set, I found I purchased them THREE YEARS AGO. They are holding up fantastic, even while covered in some minor saltwater corrosion, they open and close without sticking and still don't need to be replaced, and even the clips are not rusted and broken and cord are still intact and stretching even after 100% heated storage in an outdoor boat in the Florida sun. I was so impressed I had to leave a review.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Brace

customer_reviews.title: Easily slips out of hand. But rock solid plyers. But Black pair!
customer_reviews.text: I like the look... but easily slips out of hand for every grab... no grip, and the finger dents in it are small so its slips out of your hand. It has a tenor to it. But it's still to easy slips. The pouch has a strap that goes over it making it harder to remove for being in a hurry! Also these are long. Inch longer then the black pair. The All Black Pair, are short easy to use, doesnt slip out of hands. And pulls out of the holder easily with no strap to hold it in so easily removes.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy dutt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a whim and I am glad I did. I was skeptical at first because I normally use side cutters and needle know pliers for my fishing needs and they work fine. With this tool, I do not need either of those tools. This tool the place of both of them. They are also a lot lighter than the steel tools this is replacing. Some of the things it is great at are cutting any type of fishing line easily. It's great for opening split rings. It also is great at removing hooks.
customer_reviews.author: lpm

customer_reviews.title: not spring loaded for easy open/close functionality
customer_reviews.text: not spring loaded for easy open/close functionality. plyer tool is not tight and flat at the tip end for holding line or thin objects...lost the plastic tip holder for closing the tool when placing in the scabbard first time out...the lanyard is cheap and should not be a bounchback spring type action...got hit in the face several times. a simple 24" stainless lanyard for saltwater use would suffice. I expected much more for $20.00+
customer_reviews.author: RAKoorn

customer_reviews.title: Ok not Great. Not recommended for larger fish
customer_reviews.text: These are ok for light fishing use. On the plus side these pliers are lightweight and the clippers will cut braid cleanly. However these plierss are not surf or big fish worthy. The jaws will flex and the jaw inserts will twist under any significant load (think large blue fish or striped bass). The split ring adapter on the end of jaws makes handling small hooks kind of fiddly. Ill be looking elsewhere for my next set
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have!
customer_reviews.text: Over all these are very nice and strong. The one issue I have found is the cutting part which I thought was for hooks or Metal leaders seem not to cut any thing much over low gauge wire. One part I find very nice is if you break the tip or cutter it can be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pliers I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Seem well built, easy to use. Best fishing pliers I've owned, but then again, my last one was bought over 50 years ago. Glad some improvements have been made. Not a huge fan of the case, it just makes the thing bigger in the tackle box, but I'll use it for now. The case floats. Did an involuntary test.
customer_reviews.author: none-o-yo-biznez

customer_reviews.title: The nose is not ss i put a magnet up ...
customer_reviews.text: The nose is not ss i put a magnet up to it and it about took my finger off. already starting to rust.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Held up to tough saltwater game fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a trip to Cuba. Nippers were used all the time to cut thick tippet. Released fish. Swam with the tool attached to my belt. No signs of any problems. Love that it's lightweight. Leash worked fine although I wonder if a small float would keep it afloat so I could hand it to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: On The Water

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, high quality, and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my new pliers on the lake about 3 months ago. They were awesome. Today, the lake level is way down and my kid crawled under the dock and found them. 3-4 months under water, silt, and sand covered. He washed them with a hose and every part is functional. The only difference was a little fading of the blue color. Maybe sun or maybe water. Even the holder is unaffected today after a good cleaning. I am super Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: in stripes

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased these in hopes of having a pair of pliers to last me a long time. 3 days after getting them they ended up in the Inter-coastal waterway after my daughter dropped them. 2 weeks later I managed to fish them out and they worked perfectly and held up great. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Guardian Firearms

customer_reviews.title: They're Grrrreat!1
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and light weight. The carbide blades cut braided line better than scissors. I took them on a fishing trip for the first time on Thursday. I caught 4 largemouth bass,which I unhooked using my new pliers. They worked perfectly , and the bass were returned to the river relatively unharmed. I love the color,too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bad Sheath and citing part on pliers to small
customer_reviews.text: So far the pliers have done good, the part to cut or clipped line is to small, and the sheath is so bad made and where the belt loop is at doesn’t work right, the pliers hang on belt upside down! And the Velcro is to long to hold them in place!
customer_reviews.author: Following the striper

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice fishing pliers. These have hung around for several years and not run off like all my others usually do (lost). I also like the cutters in them and it cuts clean on 2 pound mono up to 80 pound braid with no problems (80 pound braid is largest I use, no doubt it will cut larger).
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Way better than expected, nice tool!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than I thought they would be, Very well made. Not sure about the bungie cord as I will be using these in the boat, but nice to have I guess. Jaws and cutters are replaceable, not sure where you will find them tho. For the price of these not sure why you would repair them rather than just getting another set Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: James Flinchbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Great Pliers, especially for the price. I have used them in Salt water 3 times, and they show no signs of corrosion. The Crimp part of the pliers does not work as well as I had hoped, but that is not why I bought them. They cut braid and mono line very well, and remove hooks well. The lanyard is nice to have on my Kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great. The only change I would make is to texture the handle for a non slip grip or deepen the finger indentations. They are a littler slicker than I like but the overall I would recommend them. It came with a coiled lanyard and a nylon pouch with belt loops for vertical and horizontal use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, 5 stars, easy.
customer_reviews.text: For $17, come on, these are great. Withstood heavy abuse in Nootka Sound dealing with everything from a hootchy buried deep in King salmon’s mouth to assisting with a belt repair on a Scotty downrigger. I’m sure $100 and up (like $300) pliers are a tiny bit nicer. But when I drop these on the ocean floor I won’t jump in after them.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the bug hype is about other name brand pliers that 2 or 3 times the cost of these? They work perfectly and no different then the other (high end) pliers. I'm all about quality over quantity, especially when it comes to my reels and rods, but pliers? No. This work fine, there is no play in them, the fit and finish is excellent, I have used them frequently and they work great. Highly recommended and excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Willis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend who loves to fish. The lanyard is a nice touch. An insurance policy for those like me to have dropped a few tools in the water over the years. Good design, seems well made and should last a lifetime when used as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are well built fishing pliers. I like the two tone look. The lanyard is great for hooking them onto a belt loop. Line cutter will cut mono or braid. I keep these is my shoulder bag for now. I'll probably snag another pair for my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: fourrobert13

customer_reviews.title: Great where's the rest of it
customer_reviews.text: Well it looks and feels great in hand but it DID NOT come with 1/2 of what was promised in the discription. I got the pliers and the holder DID NOT get the carabeaner or the coiled lanyard gonig to contact seller and what they are trying to pull
customer_reviews.author: Wondering Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Cool aluminum fishing pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these yet, but I am really looking forward to it. I'm ready to get back to the beach for fishing now! The pliers I have currently are steel and are constantly rusting because of the saltwater. I have to clean those way too much. As these are aluminum I'm betting I do not have to do much of anything other than wash them off. The clip seems handy as well, especially if you have a boat. The spring the clip attaches to may be a little flimsy over time, but that remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bowerman

customer_reviews.title: Not a very durable product
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine around Christmas and started using them June for our red snapper season in FL. Do a simple hook removal, they bent. I know I do not a warranty due to the time it took to use them but I would recommend some else if you are a saltwater fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Fishing Tool
customer_reviews.text: Work well, nice for the money and should hopefully last a long time. I am glad the holder has a belt slot and not a clip, a clip is the reason I lost my old set which were much more expensive and had to buy these.!! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fishing Pliers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Booms fishing pliers this week and have already put them to good use. The pliers seem to be good quality and well made. It looks nice too. Time will tell, but the pliers seem like they will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shane-Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Broke the second time I used them.
customer_reviews.text: Holding the head of a 3 foot Blacktip shark in my left hand removing the hook with my right. These cheap pliers flew to pieces and left me stranded. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Frey

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: They are lightweight. Aluminum. I have small hands and arthritis. I can use these better than any others I have found. I like the cord that comes with it. On my belt, so I don't have to look around for it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Lower quality
customer_reviews.text: Mine started to rust on the black jaws after a season's use surf fishing but more of an issue is the jaws no longer line up when closed and I can't figure out why as they are tight. Also, the belt loop on the case wasn't even sewed on completely so it was unusable and the line cutters have begun to have trouble cutting braid. Granted these are not $300 VS pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Sea_Hag

customer_reviews.title: Nice pliers - not stainless at jaws and cutter
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pliers but be sure to rinse and dry after day if fishing. Most of these have hardened non-stainless cutter and jaws and this is no exception. Saltwater will be as hard on the jaws as all steel pliers. Very happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Stolz

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are some very nice quality pliers for fishing. I use them while drag water fishing. They cut braided line so cleanly that I will never use anything else. The feel good in the hands and get a great grip on those hooks buried in the bass’ mouth. The lanyard is a great feature when juggling a fish and a rod.
customer_reviews.author: Drew McClain

customer_reviews.title: Flawless product. Functionality is great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a variety of different multi function ‘pliers’ over the years. Most had something that rusted or a function that didn’t work as anticipated. This product does everything as well if not better. The cutter works great. The design of the jaws have this little lip on the end that works perfect for that deep hook removal. I’ve used them in saltwater and freshwater with no corrosion of any kind. The lanyard that it came with is perfect for using on my fishing kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Raw4golf

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers for fishing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these pliers to tether to my kayak for use unhooking fish. The coiled lanyard expands a lot and allows a great deal of movement throughout my small boat while the pliers remain safely attached. Haven't used the cutters on braid, but I would imagine these things could shear through no problem, and they cut mono or fluro with ease. The aluminum is great for holding up against the salt, this tool should last for a number of years.
customer_reviews.author: Hoarse

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use, it is okay. The plier eventually gave out on its grip as the teeth keeps sliding away from each other when I try to remove a hook from a fish’s mouth.
customer_reviews.author: ou

customer_reviews.title: *fishing* pliers
customer_reviews.text: Not really a big fan, it is "fine" ... probably, I still prefer old-fashion need-nose pliers, as the little hook on the end of these just makes it a little more awkward. I know fishing pliers all seem to have it, so this still gets 3 stars for being a pair of fishing pliers
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Ok I love these. Great gift for a man or woman that likes to fish. I had pliers that I used was to bulky for some of the smaller fish. These are slim enough to grab the hooks on small fish when we are in the pond. And still useful for the bigger fish in the lake. I like the carbineer hook you can use it on belt loop so no dropping it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, light weight pliers.
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these for his fly fishing afternoons. They are very lightweight and have a very precision grip. The case and lanyard are a quite nice and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Montana5

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for fishing
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, very useful to have on my fishing bag. My only gripe is I wish the line cutter was more centralized in the housing, having it top heavy or bottom heavy gets me confused sometimes when I'm trying to position the line to cut. Other than that, its a must have tool in every tackle box.
customer_reviews.author: Kailoha

customer_reviews.title: Great for fresh or salt water anglers~
customer_reviews.text: I've used different styles of fishing pliers through the years with some better than others. I'm always looking for fishing gear that will simplify and expedite my time on the boat when I'm removing fish from a hook or working on getting baits back into the water. The Booms Fishing X1 Aluminum Fishing Pliers do just that. They're well built and are a good size. They're spring loaded to be open when you remove them from the included sheath which is nice. The attached lanyard is plenty long when fully extended and the crimper/wire cutter are an added bonus. I would highly recommend the pliers for fresh or salt water anglers.
customer_reviews.author: DNJ

customer_reviews.title: dont rust but need replacable cutter
customer_reviews.text: Cutter wears quickly and then forgot cutting brailed line - I keep scissors for that. Saltwater hasn't hurt them. Pulled lots of hooks out of many fish. Split ring opener works well. Wear them on every trip.
customer_reviews.author: Web

customer_reviews.title: Strong but needs lock feature
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy compared to others I have bought on amazon. Cuts braided line. The only thing I wish it had was a lock button to keep closed. Great buy tho
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great size and great feel
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a set of lower price but good pliers these are the ones, split ring feature, 7.5 long and good grip on hooks to help remove them
customer_reviews.author: rrookey

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cutting Mechanism
customer_reviews.text: What did not work for me is the small cutting mechanism that is put together with two screws that don't stay fastened well. Even if it did the cutter is not sharp enough to cut fishing line. It is a disappointment because everything else about it works well. However, I need a good cutter for fishing line so the product becomes useless. If they come up with a better design and a sharp cutter, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy clip! Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my dad, an avid fisherman. He lives that these have a strap and clip so they don’t get lost in the tackle box. He says they are much better quality than the ones he’s bought previously
customer_reviews.author: Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Freshwater Yes, Saltwater Kinda.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic fishing pliers. I fish saltwater and I rinse them Everytime but the cutting blades and a little bit of the teeth are showing rust after about a month.
customer_reviews.author: DB.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good, def not high dollar but can't put too much stress on them without bending, the cutters worked good for over an entire season of allot of fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for fishing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for a 10 yr old. He loves it. Says it works super well and before he wasn’t able to get fish off his own hook. Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: GirlNGreenScarf

customer_reviews.title: Light and strong
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are very lightweight but strong enough for the task. I like the color also....easy to detect among other fishing equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Ed D.

customer_reviews.title: Ease pf use
customer_reviews.text: better than a pair of needle nose pliers - used it several times, one was a hook buried in the belly of a small sunfish. very nice pair of pliers
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone85

customer_reviews.title: First use FAIL.!!!.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for hook removal while wade fishing the flats for trout and reds in TX. The very first hook I grabbed onto in a trout, and the jaws flexed out of shape. They were utterly useless for the purpose they are advertised for, and cannot take ANY stress, much less the reasonable force they are intended for.. These "fishing pliers hook remover" are Just Junk. I'd Never Recommend them, and regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY WAGSTAFF

customer_reviews.title: Guess they are ok
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I thought. Kind of stiff. The spring doesn’t open them too well. Don’t really use them. Just tossed them in the bag. Could have done without them.
customer_reviews.author: Don D.

customer_reviews.title: Twisting Jaws!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a replacement for an aging pair that I have been using from Gander and used them for the 1st time last night on my fishing trip for catfish and they are of such poor design that when I needed them to remove the hook from the catfish mouth all they did was twist at the plier tips.
customer_reviews.author: W.I. Gene Sandeen Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dad thinks they're greater than gold
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad on fathers day. He immediately took them to the neighbors to brag about them. He wont let anyone else use them. He isnt even this protective about his sports car
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product even like the secure lanyard to keep me from loosing it. But wished it had a lock feature on the unit itself
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Took it out fishing in the ocean and zero rusting. Of course I rinsed it off when I hot back to shore. Many many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pliers arrived missing one end of the plier end. Very poor quality and parts missing.
customer_reviews.author: KJS

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pliers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for fly fishing trips and I see they are of strong, excellent, quality. They are light weight and I like the feature of the lanyard with clips to hold the pliers if I drop them in the river.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Anlauf

customer_reviews.title: Slippery  grips
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good except the grip is very slippery out on the water . I am looking for some grips to put on the handles to prevent slipping from my hand during use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my fishing trip in Northern Canada. It's one of the best things i brought on the trip. I like it's handiness. It has that strap for your belt loop and it makes it very accessible with the holster. I took many a hook out of the plentiful bounty of Northern pike and walleye we caught.
customer_reviews.author: ari silvasti

customer_reviews.title: Compact pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace an older set I've had for many years. These are lighter weight than the older ones which is a nice feature. Held back 1 star only because I haven't had them long enough to determine durability.
customer_reviews.author: Able

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product that won't rust like normal pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting hooks out of fish and your hands. I've used them to remove a hook from my own hand - the cutting edge went through the hook shank so I could pull the hook through. They are light weight and they don't rust! The old needle nose pliers get rusty and won't work. These are great - and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin8r

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: Use them every time I go fishing on the kayak use them for what they are made for and not a prybar love them and have 3 pair
customer_reviews.author: Derek.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Surf Fishing
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers for surf fishing. Just got back from a week long trip and they didn’t rust in saltwater (yet) and lanyard makes for great ease of access. Not great for removing large hooks from sharks, but that’s not what they’re for. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work great for split rings, cuts braid effortlessly. Pliers work well also. Great value
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pliers, has the look of more expensive ones, after a summer of fishing in MN, no problems with them. I wish they didn't spring open, which is why they only get 4 stars. Great pliers otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Regular guy

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Super nice pliers! Only one thing I'd do different: grip is "slippery" so I'd cut marks to help maintain grip... sort of a knurling on handles. Them they'd be most perfect tool for fishing!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick, Montana

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Reasoinable price for fishing pliers. Work on split rings, cut line, dis-lodge hooks and more. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Great Pliers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Theses are perfect for the price, I will buy 10 of these rather than 1 pair of Van Staals.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good for off shore fishing. Quick and easy to use. Blade could be sharper for cutting lines. Came with everything as described. No rusting and has not fallen apart after approx. 10 fishing trips.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Hunsucker

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: These have become invaluable everytime i go fishing. Use them constantly and have not failed me yet. The attachment is great as i never lose them when im going through tough terrain where they might fall out of the pocket they are in.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Martinez

customer_reviews.title: good teeth on the Boom x1
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Boom x1 very good light weight and strong teeth and sharp, well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: it held up well while I was out on the boat deep sea fishing well worth the money and durability to handle lots of fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H

customer_reviews.title: All fishermen/women should have this
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. Due to my MS, its hard for me to unhook fish and these pliers give me grip strength to unhook fish as well as change trebles from lures and also use it as a crimper. But the nicest thing is the ability to cut line with it. Don't forget to clip it on your belt loop :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ken T.

customer_reviews.title: All u need in a pair of fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This isn’t just a pair of pliers. It’s got it all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: if you like fishing its a must makes it so easy to apply clips and various rings
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Not a great at cutting a hook but it can hold the hook quite well
customer_reviews.text: Can't cut thick hooks. My catch staring me deep in the eyes as I gouge out the hook and tried to cut it off. No avail. Sent it to my father in law instead and he took care of it with some time. With his hands. It was about a 10 minute ordeal. Husband tried his best to cut it but it just wasn't doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pliers
customer_reviews.text: Nice fishing pliers for the money. After several wades I would recommend this tool. They aren't titanium pliers. You do have to wash them off and apply Corrosion X after use. That being said they cost 18 bucks. The braid cutter blades get a B-. I prefer Boomerang cutters for that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have fishing tool!
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built. Haven't used them yet but they are well made and light. Will serve its purpose..
customer_reviews.author: Dom401

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pliers. Will cut any line. Yes including heavy braid with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used it all season it's been a great tool and I haven't lost it yet easy to use durable an extremely lightweight it's perfect I wish there were a few more tools on it but it does exactly what I need
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I use them alot in salt water. I had them for about three years now and still in perfect condition. (NO RUST)
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Received used and opened item
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box to find what was very obviously a used set of fishing pliers, already out of their packaging with some of the parts assembled already. As a gift, I’m very disappointed at this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cab Rinalda

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and gorgeous blue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my man for Christmas and he loved it! I wasn’t quite sure what it did exactly but I know it’s fishing gear haha and he said it was really good quality and he loves the blue color! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pres

customer_reviews.title: Well made and can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built nice looking like a expensive pair of Pliers
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: never heard of this brand but im pleased with the quality. i use it for saltwater and i wash it everytime after, ive never had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were pretty shnazzy pliers
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty shnazzy pliers. While I'm fairly certain the "chinesium" these are made out of will most likely corrode over time, they are pretty inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I’m giving it a 5 cuz they are light and ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it a 5 cuz they are light and they look kool but I hope they don’t rust or the red doesn’t fade becuz I won’t hesitate on changing my review on it.
customer_reviews.author: FRANCO

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: Works great, is light weight cutter is sharp will cut braided line every time. Great addition to my fishing tackle
customer_reviews.author: Joe 532

customer_reviews.title: Large
customer_reviews.text: work well so far but I'm pretty sure the were meant for Andre the giant. not for panfish or trout
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: Great product great value
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pliers they are excellent for Remove in trouble hooks from fish. Also they are a great value for the money. They also come in very handy for cutting braid line. Would not hesitate to purchase again
customer_reviews.author: del

customer_reviews.title: Emergency surgery
customer_reviews.text: I live stream fishing at twitch.tv/ParoXitiC and use these daily to unhook largemouth and other fish. They work great as long cutters and you can perform emergency surgery easy.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch.tv/ParoXitiC

customer_reviews.title: These are Light! Needs clip on case.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and nice quality. Haven't used them a bunch yet but they look good. Only thing missing is the case has no clip to slide over your shorts. So unless you wear a belt on a boat there is no good way to keep these on your waist.
customer_reviews.author: La Aluminati

customer_reviews.title: A must for any fisherman
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing hooks deep in the mouth and has an excellent line cutter. The lanyard is a added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Travis W

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them fishing and they’re working great.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Modification made for improvment............
customer_reviews.text: These would be 5 star pliers if they had a lock to keep them closed OR they didn't have a spring that kept them wide open at rest. They are so wide open at rest that it takes two hands or some fumbling to get them closed. I was, with effort, able to remove the center screw and remove the keep-open spring. However the center screw is held on with lock-tight or some other glue and it is difficult to remove. So far so good with this modification, but I realize I may need to reapply lock-tight to keep it adjusted properly. Too bad Booms hasn't added the keep-closed lock that they had promised to their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Northwoods Guideman

product_meta.title: Booms Fishing X1 Aluminum Fishing Pliers Hook Remover Braid Line Cutting and Split Ring with Coiled Lanyard and Sheath
feature_bullets: X1 fishing pliers is aluminum handle and stainless steel jaws and other parts construction. It can open split ring remove hooks and cutting braided line
[Aluminum Handle Inset Spring] Using aluminum handle is more lightweight and support inset the braided line cutters. The pliers can automatically open when there loaded spring

[Feature Fishing Jaws] The stainless steel jaws added a small hook at the top for opening the stubborn split rings it can help you repair your lure. There also with a split lead and single-barrel crimping position

[Super Braided Line Cutters] Unlike the previous pliers, Aluminum fishing pliers can cutting braided line and mono line for inset braided cutters. You just line up the pliers you can get smooth and clean cut

[Secure your Pliers, No Lost Again] We plus a steel wire coiled lanyard and nylon holster to always keep this handy tool within easy reach and security. You can wear on you belt or you fishing bag, keep you hands free
